div.p: When you’re in Year 7 you’re sort of a small fish in a giant pond, everyone’s trying to figure out their place and you know with all the problems I had at home
you know I was quite hostile as a kid and kids are generally hostile to each other, you know kids can be cruel and I didn’t take well to that
and the other kids didn’t take well to that so I wasn’t very popular with the kids and they weren’t very popular with me but as you get older
people become more understanding so it’s easier to make friends I think. I mean through Year 7 to Year 11 it wasn’t fantastic but as I went into Sixth Form
it was like a new slate, I could wipe the slate clean, making friends was actually surprisingly a lot easier, there was no pressure, I think partially because
I didn’t say that I was in care or anything like that, you know, they just respected me for who I was rather than what I was like beforehand.
I don’t know, I actually don’t know that, I don’t think anyone really encouraged me to stay in school or do certain things or anything like that
just went with it, just I know that I didn’t want to have the lifestyle that I had and I knew the best way to do that was to go through school at the time
